item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, May 7, 2025 at 7:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Waiting for Postgres 18: Accelerating Disk Reads with Asynchronous I/O (253 points | 66 comments)
2. Ty: A fast Python type checker and language server, written in Rust (107 points | 38 comments)
3. Show HN: eInk optimized manga with Kindle Comic Converter (+Kobo/ReMarkable) (144 points | 24 comments)
4. Three Chapters at Cloudflare: Programmer to CTO to Board of Directors (123 points | 17 comments)
5. Create and edit images with Gemini 2.0 in preview (74 points | 36 comments)
6. Mistral ships le chat – enterprise AI assistant that can run on prem (76 points | 18 comments)
7. Open source Google Analytics replacement (19 points | 5 comments)
8. Telling Lies: Bowie and Online Music Distribution in 1996 (37 points | 22 comments)
9. My quest to make motorcycle riding that tad bit safer (156 points | 164 comments)
10. Motion (YC W20) Is Hiring a Senior Engineers ( | hide)
11. So Much Blood (236 points | 100 comments)
12. Zed: High-performance AI Code Editor (378 points | 272 comments)
13. CLion Is Now Free for Non-Commercial Use (416 points | 276 comments)
14. Unity’s Open-Source Double Standard: the ban of VLC (394 points | 110 comments)
15. Show HN: 100.st – Dev utilities I built for format conversions and encoding (18 points | 8 comments)
16. Stringly Typed (18 points | 27 comments)
17. Single hair-like electrode outperforms traditional 21-lead EEG (7 points | 2 comments)
18. Polycompiler: Merge Python and JavaScript code into one file that runs in both (44 points | 8 comments)
19. Perfect Random Floating-Point Numbers (68 points | 35 comments)
20. OpenSearch 3.0 Released (52 points | 15 comments)
21. OpenAI reaches agreement to buy Windsurf for $3B (632 points | 543 comments)
22. Samsung is paying $350M for audio brands B&W, Denon, Marantz and Polk (25 points | 15 comments)
23. Launch HN: Exa (YC S21) – The web as a database (384 points | 128 comments)
24. Using tests as a debugging tool for logic errors (26 points | 11 comments)
25. Claude's system prompt is over 24k tokens with tools (530 points | 271 comments)
26. Cuttlefish 'talk' with their arms, study reveals (101 points | 69 comments)
27. Getting Older Isn't What You Think (97 points | 100 comments)
28. Matt Godbolt sold me on Rust by showing me C++ (538 points | 509 comments)
29. WebMonkeys: parallel GPU programming in JavaScript (2016) (110 points | 18 comments)
30. docker2exe: Convert a Docker image to an executable (121 points | 73 comments)
